intro: Centaurea sinaica, commonly known as the Sinai centaury, is a flowering plant native to the rocky and arid regions of the Sinai Peninsula. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm, with narrow, lance-shaped leaves and bright blue or violet flowers. Its ability to thrive in harsh, dry environments makes it an important component of the local flora. Centaurea sinaica is also valued for its ornamental appeal and has been used in traditional medicine in some regions.
